summary: Rules provide system-level instructions to Agent. They bundle prompts, scripts, and more together, making it easy to manage and share workflows. Cursor supports Project Rules, User Rules, Team Rules, and AGENTS.md.
key_takeaways: Project Rules are stored in .cursor/rules as markdown files and are version-controlled.
Rule types include Always Apply, Apply Intelligently, Apply to Specific Files (globs), and Apply Manually.
Keep rules under 500 lines and reference files instead of copying contents.
AGENTS.md is a simple markdown alternative to .cursor/rules for straightforward use cases.

questions.question: Where are Project Rules stored in a Cursor project?
questions.explanation: Project rules live in .cursor/rules as markdown files (.md or .mdc) and are version-controlled, making them shareable across teams.

questions.question: Which rule type should you use when you want the rule to apply only when working with TypeScript files?

options.text: Apply to Specific Files with globs like *.ts

questions.explanation: 'Apply to Specific Files' uses globs patterns to match files. Setting globs to '*.ts' will apply the rule only when working with TypeScript files.

questions.question: What's the recommended approach if your rules become too numerous?

options.text: Combine all rules into one large file
Delete older rules to make room for new ones
Split them into more specific categories with appropriate globs or descriptions
Convert them all to AGENTS.md format

questions.explanation: When rules become too numerous, split them into more specific categories. Use globs like 'only apply when working with user inputs' or detailed descriptions for intelligent application.
